intro: [WRONG START] Habenaria cultriformes, commonly known as the sickle-leaf orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
